intro: Crawfurdia crawfurdioides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. Crawfurdia crawfurdioides is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
